Hi all,
I downloaded and set up the 1.5 version of Heritrix from svn, on the 
hopes that its memory performance was significantly better than the 
older 1.3 version we had been using before.

Our problem, in a nutshell, was that Heritrix would run out of memory 
eventually, no matter how much we gave the JVM.  Our larger tasks 
therefore could not be accomplished with Heritrix.

Michael Stack recommended that we migrate from Heritrix 1.3 to Heritrix 
1.5, and this was done.  However, I am finding only marginally better 
memory consumption numbers with Heritrix 1.5.  For a task that is 
partway completed that has 320,000 scanned documents and 660,000 queued 
documents, the base memory consumption seems to be about 200Mb. 
Extending this to 2.5 million documents (our current task) will require 
more than 1.6GB of JVM memory, which is better than Heritrix 1.3 but not 
by much.

We are using the default profile, with only minor changes.

Any further advice?  Am I missing something?

Karl
